Reviews.Title: looks aren't everything, this thing rocks!!!!
Reviews.Author: C. Mills "mom of 3"
Reviews.Content: I think this is the best camera I have ever owned.  It is a little old school looking, but I personally like it.  The image stabilization is great, it's got a built in wide angle lens, it zooms without the lens moving on the outside, it's a very nice camera.  I did my research before I bought this one and went to consumer reports and this camera had the highest ratings for the portable point and shoot cameras. Plus it is very affordable.  Highly recommend this camera

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: JR Mack "Whatever"
Reviews.Content: Takes pictures extremely fast.  Can take a picture within ~1-2 seconds of turning the camera on.  Consecutive pictures come very quickly, even when charging the flash.  One of the few point and shoot camera's that will allow you to zoom in and out while shooting 720P video.  I used to buy Canon camera's exclusively, but I wanted to start shooting quick video clips of my kids, so I was specifically looking for a great point and shoot that takes acceptable video.  I shoot video when something is happening, which usually means you would like to zoom to keep the action in frame.  Takes great quality pictures.  4.6 optical zoom is also above average for this price point.  Great for super close ups as well.Have been extremely happy with this camera, once I sent the first one back to J&R; due to a spec of dust internal to the camera.  I would give them one out of 5 stars for the extremely slow handling of my RMA.

Reviews.Title: awesome!
Reviews.Author: Fabuchef
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time looking at the ratings on this camera.  Consumer Reports recommends it, and the reviews on every other website I checked out seemed very positive.  I was not disappointed.  Once the power button is turned on, the camera is ready to take a picture in 2-3 seconds (great for those spontaneous shots).  There's a feature that automatically detects the best settings to use for every shot you take.  It's compact and lightweight.  The screen is very clear and plenty large, and the controls are simple to understand.  All in all, this was a great purchase, and I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Lumix DMC-FP8 Review
Reviews.Author: John K. Murphy
Reviews.Content: I decided on the DCM-FP8 based on a couple of previous Lumix models I have had.  This model caught my attention for 2 primary reasons; 1) the 12.1 MP quality and 2) the image stabilization feature.  I use a camera mostly on the job and take quick and spontaneous shots (image stabilization becomes very important.)  This unit does not let me down!  The picture quality is superb and the portability is exactly what I was looking for--I highly recommend the DCM-FP8 if you are looking for a simple to use, high quality, and portable "point-n-shoot" camera.

Reviews.Title: Great FP8
Reviews.Author: A. gomez "L-Boy"
Reviews.Content: I am a big Canon fan. My last camera was a five year old G2. It gave me years of quality service. I almost went with the Canon Elfs as I was now looking for a pocket camera. But I after researching I decided to take a chance on the FP8. Really happy I did. It came when it was supposed to. Everything was there.( also bought extra memory and battery)It was supposed to be used, but I couldn't tell; looks brand new to me: in the original box and packing.Took a bunch of pics and video in several modes and environments.I expected the pic to be really good and they were. In fact, even better than I expected. I don't expect to take much video with it, but I tested it anyway. Wow! Did not expect the video to be so great. I cant believe these little pocket point and shoots have this kind of picture and video quality.  Camera, extra battery and 8GB of extra memory for $200. I took the free shipping. Took like 6 days to get to me, I was in no rush. I'm happy.I am now a fan of Canon and Panasonic. Also, if you don't take much video,only pics, 8GB memeory card  is over kill. But it was so cheap I bought it anyway. With the ease of use, and quality, of  the video I may start taking more video. If I do, I have plenty of room for it.

Reviews.Title: JUST THE CAMERA I WAS LOOKING FOR!!!
Reviews.Author: Barry M. Dodson "BNL"
Reviews.Content: Consulted a professional photographer friend and told him I wanted a small (for traveling), easy-to-use (I have no real interest in bells & whistles) camera that has great battery life and a fast recovery rate between shots.  Without missing a beat he recommended the Panasonic Lumix DMC-FP8.  I ordered it on a Friday and got it Monday morning!!!!! That's shipped via priority mail/USPS from LA and to Orlando!  Amazingly fast delivery.  Charged the battery and took about 15 minutes to set it up and start taking great pictures. Blazingly fast startup and recovery between shots (both with flash and w/o).  It comes with an instruction manual, software, AV & USB wires, battery & charger. (Note, it does not come with a photo storage card. . .you'll need to purchase this separately.) It is a perfect camera for my type of picture taking and very compact.  You will love the Intelligent Auto feature. . .makes taking great pictures brainless.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Evan
Reviews.Content: I'm not one for writing reviews, however I thought I should help offset the negative review (that is obviously for a different product.)  I do own the camera, it has a quick response when shooting pictures, takes nice video, and has a multitude of different modes and settings.  So it's a solid point and shoot, decent battery life, and a good price.

Reviews.Title: Great small camera for the price, don't zoom though
Reviews.Author: jnaerials
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous little camera.  It does not have any lense that has to retract when it turns on so it turns on fast, focuses fast, and takes fabulous pictures.  I actually put it in my rc airplane and takes pictures from the sky with it.  It always takes perfectly clear pictures when doing this.My only complaint is that when I zoom in (not used in my airplane) in any normal use like in the house, kids playing outside, etc - the picture gets grainy.  Hence the 4 star rather than 5.  But I don't normally use the zoom function so it takes great pics.The HD video is cool too, I just wish it would take the video in a different format than .mov which is a very large file type.Battery seems to last quite a long time.  300 pics or more.All-in-all, it's a great compact camera for sticking in your pocket and taking pictures on the fly.

Reviews.Title: I'd buy another
Reviews.Author: Joanne Eisenried
Reviews.Content: I love the camera. Now I can carry it with me all the time. Takes up hardly any room in my purse. Pictures I have taken have been of excellent quality. My previous camera I was getting quit a few fuzzy pictures. Not sure if it was the camera or me. I am not getting fuzzy pictures now.

Reviews.Title: lens should be in the middle
Reviews.Author: K. Woods "k woods"
Reviews.Content: the camera takes great pictures and the controls are easy to use.  the only flaw is that the lens is up in the left hand corner instead of in the middle of the camera so i have taken a lot of pictures with my finger in the frame.  the camera is very small so someone with big hands like myself might want to consider a camera that is a little bigger...i am always feeling like i am going to drop it when i try to get my fingers out of the way to snap a picture.

Reviews.Title: First digital camera. I'm pretty happy about it.
Reviews.Author: R. Posner
Reviews.Content: I can't say I know too much about digital cameras so I can't really determine its grade compared to other's on the market. All I can say really is that this was a very inexpensive camera. It's small, portable has a big screen to take pictures with. The picture quality is awesome. Lots of features I barely know what to do with. I didn't buy a memory card with it but that's perfectly fine cause I can just adjust the size of the image and store like(near) 300 pictures on the built in memory alone. For a first camera I imagine I couldn't of picked up a better make and model for this price.Only thing I've noticed is that when you zoom with the thing, because it's a digital zoom, it causes a bit of blur if you move it around too much but it stabalizes pretty quickly.

Reviews.Title: Great easy to use camera
Reviews.Author: A. Diaz Rivera "casca1980"
Reviews.Content: Great camera. Easy to use and almost no blurry pics! Great zoom and panoramic view

Reviews.Title: Snappy
Reviews.Author: J. Hellings "Ssippishark"
Reviews.Content: Great camera for point and shoot.  The movies are divine in 720 16:9 on my home tv, but are in Quicktime .mov format.  I convert them, or use Home player classic - movie cinema to view them as quicktime and windows has some issues.  The camera is small enough to drop in my pocket right after turning it off as there is no projecting lenses even when zooming.  I tend to shake like a weed in the wind when taking pictures, but just about all of my pictures have come out clear with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding little camera
Reviews.Author: GizmoNut
Reviews.Content: I own a Fuji S7000 camera, and it's still my favorite if I need a super sharp shot, but it's the size of an SLR and doesn't have image stability at all, so a tripod is almost a requirement for a non-blurry shot.  This little Lumix is extremely portable, and when I got it, I literally charged up the battery and then turned it on and started taking excellent pictures.  As others have mentioned, it turns on very fast, and takes pictures in rapid succession (get a class 6 SDHC card for best performance).  Picture quality is better than every other digital camera I own currently, with very little noise in the shots, even in low light.  There are other cameras out there of similar size that have fancy OLED touch screens, cute curves, etc, and I've tried them all - you can keep 'em, because what the FP8 lacks in style, it certainly makes up in substance.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Olga
Reviews.Content: I shopped around before finally choosing this and I'm not disappointed!  Beautiful pictures, rich color (especially if you use vivid mode.)  See my sample photos in the product description.  Versatile and intuitive camera.  I have a DSLR and wanted a smaller pocket-size camera that's easier to take with me where ever I go.  I have to say, the quality of the images rival that of my DSLR!  The only shortcoming is that it's not as crisp and you do see some noise if you magnify the image -- but that's only if you really magnify and the picture was taken in low light, otherwise this isn't a problem. The macro capability is amazing, which is even better due to the higher pixel count, which allows you to crop and get an even closer up shot.  All in all, this camera fully fulfills my needs, and as a result my DSLR has been sitting on the shelf!

Reviews.Title: Great subcompact!
Reviews.Author: Doug Wise
Reviews.Content: We were changing from a Samsung that we didn't like. This one was the highest rated on Consumer Reports and we have been Very Happy!

Reviews.Title: If you want a fast shooting point and shoot with clear pictures this is it
Reviews.Author: JSTAR
Reviews.Content: Got this camera after reading how responsive it was and how nice the pictures were.My wife and I were looking for a camera that we would use on AUTO setting 99% of the time that would take consistent good quality pictures.I bought a canon sd1300 (great reviews) after our canon sd750 broke.  We were so happy with the sd750 that I gave canon another chance.  Well I must have had a defective unit because I shot pictures on auto and they all came out yellow and blurry, I returned it and after coming to amazon and reading reviews (fun and addictive) I thought I would give Lumix a try.  I was looking for #1 clear pictures and #2 fast shooting. (taking lots of pictures of kids and have to focus and shoot fast even indoors)Well I got it from Discountjungle through amazon and the shipping was VERY FASTIt is the fastest point and shoot I've tried compared to other canon point and shoot cameras I've owned.The picture clarity is very good.  I'd say at least 95% as good if not equal to our old canon sd750.  Taking pictures indoors and in darker rooms indoors the pictures came out very good!The construction sees solid and it weighs more than I thought it would.The camera is very responsive.  I'd say at least twice as fast as my last Canon.Unlike what another reviewer stated you CAN zoom in and move around the pictures while in view mode.  Just use the zoom toggle to zoom in and use the 4 directional buttons to move around on the picture.I was also concerned where the placement of the lens was due to reading other reviews, but I'm right handed and it hasn't been a problem at all.  In fact, what they didn't say was, the placement of the flash is perfect being in the middle because on my old canon the flash would sometimes get covered my my hand causing less effective flash.This camera has made me want to try a higher end Lumix that may give me even better images but this one is the perfect fit for what I was looking for.  Like another reviewer stated in there review about one of the Lumix cameras, using auto setting, the camera won't let you take a bad picture LOL, after owning Canons and having to wait for the pre focus etc, I know what they were talking about now.  The Canons would take great pictures if you would hold the button down 1/2 way and wait for the camera to focus etc before pressing fully, and I didn't have a problem with this, but my wife never got the hang of it.  So ~20% or so of the pictures she took would have problems because she hurried the camera.  It seems that the Panasonic Lumix FP8 does things differently or either processes things so quickly you never have to wait on it.  This will suit her much better.

Reviews.Title: Low stress photography & great fun
Reviews.Author: Happy Reader
Reviews.Content: Have owned it just over a month. . . traveled with it. . . shot stills, video. . . micro, full zoom, aerial. . . flash, timer, many modes. . . Intelligent Auto or selected settings. . . this camera makes photography fun!  It travels in a shirt or jacket pocket virtually unnoticed, or packages up in a soft carrying case with a spare battery, SD Card, and small cloth for cleaning the screen/lens that's just 4 1/2"x3"x1 1/2" for those short vacations.  And with a spare battery, it easily gets through a 3 to 4 day vacation at 100+ pictures/day without recharging anything.  Picture quality is far and away good enough for those of us looking to "record family history" on anything up to 8x10.  If you have owned another camera with features, you'll be able to find your way around the Menus and Modes without too much hassle. . . or just jump to Intelligent Auto which works well 90+% of the time.  For me, it passes the most critical test . . . it's small enough to take anywhere without a hassle, and takes very good pictures!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: R. DePoy
Reviews.Content: This camera works great and takes great photos.  I'm still learning it's "tricks" but easy enough to figure most stuff out. The screen is HUGE compared to my last camera and I like that the buttons light up on the back.

Reviews.Title: Poor Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: RockonPirates
Reviews.Content: I feel one of the most important features of any camera is the quality of the photos.  All of the photos taken with this camera were poor quality. I was quite surprised given all the positive reviews. I took two dozen pictures in different lighting conditions, indoor and out in automatic mode. When I loaded them on my laptop all of the pictures looked washed out. There was a fuzziness about them. The colors just seemed bland to me. So I pulled up some pictures from my older Kodak V550 (5MP) and these pictures had vivid colors and a crispness. Well to validate my thoughts further I borrowed a Sony compact point and shoot from a friend and took the cameras on a stroll and took indoor and outdoor pictures of the same scene with each of the them. I did this at dusk and again at full day light with both cameras set in the full automatic mode. Comparing the pictures side by side on the same laptop there was an absolute clear difference in the quality of the pictures. The Lumix FP8 pictures were washed out, reds and blues looked dull and faded. With the Sony the colors were bright, vivid, and photos were clear and had a nice pop to them. I changed some of the settings on the Lumix especially the one that turned "vivid" on. This did not help. Some other things I learned with the Lumix are that 12 mega pixels probably don't buy you anything maybe unless you want to print large 10X12 pictures. Also, I was intrigued that this camera had HD video. But what I realized after shooting several 30 second clips is that the HD video mode eats a lot of hard  drive space and since the files are so large it takes a lot longer to transfer them  to the HD drive. I switched the video mode to VGA and found that for my purposes the playback on a PC was the same quality as in HD mode and the files size was 70% smaller. I returned the Lumix FP8 today and decided to go with the Cannon SD1200IS which is an older model with 10MP and VGA video. Look at the 500 plus reviews and 99% of them rave about the picture quality. I will update this review when I receive the Cannon and compare photos.I received the Canon SD1200IS. I did the same comparison picture quality test. The picture quality was much better with the Canon. I purchased this model refurbished by Canon from J&R; for $99. It looks and feels brand new.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera!
Reviews.Author: Cambria Moran
Reviews.Content: I just can't say enough about this camera. I really love everything about it. I looked around for quite a bit comparing cameras before settling on this and I'm so glad I did. Aside from all the spectacular settings on this, the Auto setting is amazing. It is constantly sensing where you are and what type of light is there. All my photos are so sharp and clean, better than I ever would have expected. I use the higher sensitivity setting from a moving car and the photos are so sharp you'd think I was standing still. I also really love the pin hole setting and have taken some really nice dramatic shots with it. The zoom on this is very nice, and I love that it's internal. I used to have a Canon Powershot that I thought was great but everytime I wanted to use it I had to wait for the lens to pop and focus. This Panasonic is instantly on and ready to go as soon as I flip the switch. It's also really lightweight so I can keep it in my purse. I love having a rechargeable battery for this instead of needing to replace them. And the battery life is really long. As far as I'm concerned this Lumix performs better than the newer models with higher Megapixels and bigger zoom. Love it!

Reviews.Title: Best in its category and price
Reviews.Author: Hakan Toktas "gear freak"
Reviews.Content: I was a Sony user before this camera but after I dropped my Sony I wanted to give a chance to this one because it was more cheaper with good reviews and specifications. I can honestly say that I'm happy that my old camera was broken, it was so slow comparing to this one and image quality wasn't better than this one. This thing can focus so quickly and you dont miss any shots. It's just the way I like, kids don't like to wait while you picture them. It has some noise issues in low light but I think it's a common problem on point and shoot cameras. I recommend this camera to anyone looking for a cheap and portable point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Point and shoot
Reviews.Author: lawretj
Reviews.Content: We travelled across America, on a motorcycle. My wife snapped 1064 pictures while we were on the road. The picture quality is superb, the camera is simple to use, easy to access when you want to get a quick shot and the software support is next to none. Worth the price and it's recommended by Consumers Reports.

Reviews.Title: The Best Point and shoot for the Price
Reviews.Author: Josel Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: For $159.00, this camera is probably the best point and shoot camera in the market to date.  Some of the outdoor shots coming out of this camera is similar to my full frame Nikon D700 DSLR camera.  Indoor shots are great too; however, I would not recommend this camera for fast indoor sports photography without a flash.  The black color is the cheapest color.  Other colors go above the $200.00 range.  I personally like the black color; so, stick with the black color, pay the lower cost you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!  Excellent Pictures and Ease of Use!
Reviews.Author: gatorbatch
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because the portable Olympus FE-230 I previously used for my past 2 summer trips was inconsistent in picture quality.  I travel as a leader for a student group and have so much other stuff to carry that I want a camera that slips in to my pocket and  obviously takes great photos.  My mother has a Panasonic Lumix DMC-TZ3 that takes exceptional pictures, so I looked in to getting one myself.  The DMC-FP8 was top rated in Consumer Reports and turned out to be all that I wanted and more.  The size is what I was looking for, the picture quality is excellent, and there are so many extra features that I wasn't even planning on but I got with this camera!  I have just returned from 3 weeks in Europe and took about 1500 pictures.  The clarity, color, and overall quality is fantastic.  I was able to get larger shots in the frame when others I was with could not.  I was also able to zoom in from quite a distance and capture a great photo.  Battery life was very good, and ease of menu and options was simple.  I will say that the one down side to the camera as noted by other reviewers is the ability to catch your finger in the photo due to the lens being located on the left side of the camera.  However, I quickly adjusted my "habit" of grasping the camera over the front when taking two handed pictures, and at other times could easily take a photo just using my right hand only.  Overall: I'm very pleased with the camera and thankful that I chose to get it prior to my trip!  I would highly recommend the Lumix DMC-FP8!

Reviews.Title: Good as advertised
Reviews.Author: Roadrunner
Reviews.Content: Like many people, I selected this Panasonic DMC-FP8 because it was the Consumer Reports Magazine's highest rated choice in subcompact cameras.  Also because when the Sony I purchased recently got dust on it, the lens would no longer come out of the camera.  But the Lumix's Leica lens is sealed inside the body where no dust can penetrate. You just keep the outside cover glass clean. It is as good as advertised. It has all the features anyone could want, including image stabilizer and almost 5X optical zoom.  Low light pictures are clear without flash. It turns on easily with a switch and is ready instantly.  Other cameras take a minute to get ready. There is no lag between pictures, even when I use a 4 series chip instead of the faster 6 series.  It offers face recognition, etc.  The price at Amazon was terrific.  I got the black model which was $75 cheaper than red(?) The black holster with magnetic clip is a steal at just a few dollars.

Reviews.Title: Lumix camera
Reviews.Author: Happy Mom
Reviews.Content: I bought the Lumix camera for my 26 year old son and he loves it.  He especially likes the short videos! We recently got together with other family and we all had so much fun with the Lumix!  I bought it at a reasonable price it arrived in good time and all in all was a great purchase!

Reviews.Title: Considering its price, acceptable point-and-shoot in the Lumix line
Reviews.Author: Harry Lin
Reviews.Content: I researched lower-priced point-and-shoot cameras here on Amazon and based on the reviews for the Lumix DMC-FP8, I bought this camera.  So I thought I'd contribute back to the Amazon customer review ecosystem and add my two cents.  As quickie background, I am not a professional photographer.  I wanted a simple, inexpensive PandS for quick shots in the office and while traveling.  My family and I have a better digital still camera that we use for "important" photos.I paid the Amazon price you're probably seeing on this page, and my rating takes that heavily into account.  I don't like this camera's construction quality, I think its form factor is problematic, and the picture quality is barely acceptable.  With a slam like that, you'd think I'd have given this product one star, but for [...], well, you get what you pay for.More details on my negatives...Build quality:  This thing feels almost like a high-end children's toy.  I've had Canon digital ELPHs, a Nikon, and another higher-priced Panasonic Lumix and they all felt stronger and tighter.  Metal and higher-quality plastics, better fitting and pressing and sliding.  "Made in China" (of course, at this price point) usually means lower quality construction and this camera really shows it.  If you've used a Made in Japan Canon PandS, for example, you can tell the difference immediately.  I am afraid this camera is going to fall apart in a year.Form factor:  It's convenient that the lens doesn't extend and retract.  Flush front surface, no moving parts, no motor-y noise -- that's all good.  But the lens hole is in the upper right corner of the front of the camera and when you hold it to take a picture, you are almost always covering the lens.  Other reviewers have noted this and it's a problem because your natural tendency is to hold the camera that way.Picture quality:  This is the worst part of this camera.  I've read all the various reviewers' advice and guidance about changing settings to get the best pictures, but I'm not happy with the quality of the pics I'm getting from the FP8.  I have taken essentially the same photos in the same conditions with my other PandS cameras (all on the easy auto setting) and they are all better.  Of course, all the PandS cameras I'm refering to cost quite a bit more than this Lumix.  I assume they have better chips and/or better lenses than this camera.So, as I said, it's about price-to-quality.  For about [...], I'm giving the Panasonic Lumix FP8 a passing grade.  But if you can spend more, my bottom line is "Spend more!" and buy a better point-and-shoot.Thanks for reading.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good when you tweak it
Reviews.Author: SpeedoNJ "Len"
Reviews.Content: Within the past few months I purchased 3 compact cameras in the 12+ megapixel range with 5X zoom or more.  They were this Lumix, because I love my old FX30, Sony WSC-370 be cause I love my a10 DSLR, and Nikon S70, because I love my P80.  Wanted to see who has the best compact when it wasn't appropriate to lug around the above named larger models.At first, I though this was clearly the worst. First couple of tries the pictures were unremarkable, which surprised me.  Using it in automatic setting was not resulting in good pictures.Then I discovered that, for my taste at least, it needed to be operated at a very low ISO (80) replicating SLOW film, bringing brighter contrast and colors.Now, I still don't deem the zoom the best, but for outside landscape shots, it does very well.The other thing to take care with is the exposed lens.  Unlike the other two pocket cameras I mentioned, it does not have a cover when turned off.  I use the packing sleeve, then put it in a case.  Which to me means no carrying it around loose in your pocket.If I could, would give it a 3 1/2 star review. The irritations are insurmountable if it takes good photos, which it does.

Reviews.Title: Love it so far...
Reviews.Author: cleostein
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my Sony Cybershot (which I dearly loved). My Cybershot is still in good working order, but my husband wanted a small camera to take fishing and didn't want to worry about caring for a new one.I was looking for something small enough to take anywhere in my purse or pocket.  I read TONS of reviews on cameras and ended up choosing this one because it was Consumer Reports top pick.  I have just returned from vacation where I took hundreds of pictures and I am very happy with the photo quality.  I think my Cybershot took better pictures with the flash off, but other than that I cannot complain.  There are still alot of features that I have not tried yet...I'm pretty much a point-and-shoot kind of girl!I would highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful camera
Reviews.Author: Richard H. Pattillo
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for anyone.  I bought it for my wife to carry with her for those special pictures that come up unexpectedly.  There is no need to fool around with a bunch of settings.  You just turn it on and it is ready.  Takes great pictures indoors and outdoors.  It does have all the "settings" if you like to tinker, but is just great on auto.  I would reccommend this camera for anyone.

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: Paul M. Bicknell "PMB"
Reviews.Content: This camera is what I was looking for: compact, good quality and has a fast refresh rate. I love the burst mode.Picture quality is very good but not great...there is some sacrifice for size but compared to other compacts that are this small it is excellent.My goal was to find a good quality camera that slips into a pocket and I could not be happier.

Reviews.Title: I love the size and image stabilation
Reviews.Author: Ron Rivchin "Ron Rivchin"
Reviews.Content: Caught great videos on the spur of the moment that I would have missed if weren't for the size and portablity.  Also the wide angle lens is really the best feature on this camera for artsy off center close ups.  Got this kit for $16 and it is helpful for Lumix owners.  Panasonic Lumix Digital Cameras Accessory Kit with Camera Case & Tripod for DMC-FS7 FS15 FS25 FX37 FX48 FX150 FX580 FZ28 LS85 LX3 TZ50 TS1 ZS1 ZS3

Reviews.Title: very convenient
Reviews.Author: Leah
Reviews.Content: This little camera is very convenient for vacations, etc.  I didn't expect much from the video function, but the quality is great!

Reviews.Title: What's not in the box
Reviews.Author: Joe the Nurse
Reviews.Content: I love my new camera, and at such a great price!  It arrived very quickly, too.  Just so you know, this camera box does not come with a camera case or a memory card, and the camera only holds about 5 photos without a memory card.  It appears that memory cards START at $15.  The box does include a battery, battery charger, USB cable, AV cable, and hand strap, and some software.  The battery needs to be charged for 2 hours before use.

Reviews.Title: Decent snaps, good size, watch your fingers
Reviews.Author: Parvati
Reviews.Content: Great hand-held size, super cute, easy to use, shoots fast, and easy to get to know. Most of the pictures have turned out great, with good true color, however, some images have turned out slightly off - not super sharp and crisp. I'm still playing around with learning the features, so am hoping to figure out how to ameliorate this. For the most part I'm happy with it since it wasn't expensive and it's easy to pull out of a pocket and take a picture. The energy save feature keeps it in a "sleep" mode, that makes waking it to take a snap much faster than having to turn it all the way on from a full "off" mode. The lens in the upper corner does take some adjusting to, to avoid putting one's fingers in all the shots, but overall, I like the look of the camera and I like the look of the snaps. I needed a p&s; to replace a Pentax that is having recurring lens trouble, and this is working out fine. The Leica lens is a plus for how inexpensive is it.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: I love this one so much that now, a year after I bought my first and it was just snatched from me, I've ordered another one as a replacement.  I've taken a look at the newer stuff, and I'm sold that this one is still the best.Super fast to start up and I am able to capture tons of pictures that I would have missed with other cameras, and that's what this is all about -- happy snappies.  Also like the 4+x optical zoom.  There are ample decent little features on those rare occasions when I choose to dig into them.  All these things have too many buttons and features, but I found this one very intuitive after a the initial confusion and I was worried about that because I was switching over from many years of Canon use.The only drawback is that I have a few pictures of my finger, as the lens is way up at the top left as you are taking the picture.  But you can figure that out.

Reviews.Title: So far has been a great camera
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Sullivan
Reviews.Content: So far I have really liked this camera.  I will saw that the camera lens is in a weird spot and I have found many pictures with my finger in it.  It may take me a while to change how I hold the camera.  Also, switching from picture to video is a few extra steps more than I like.  My other cameras I could toggle a switch to change from camera to video.  On this camera I have to go into a menu to switch that over.  It is not a major deal.  Other than that the battery life is amazing and the pictures come out really nice.  I have not had a chance to play with all the bells and wistles.

Reviews.Title: this is the best camera ever
Reviews.Author: LAN
Reviews.Content: This camera is very good and nice and cool... i love it, it's the best camera i ever had on this world :)

Reviews.Title: Great *little* camera
Reviews.Author: Tezza "Tezza"
Reviews.Content: Here are the strong points of this camera:- Very small, about the size of a pack of cards with half the thickness- Very speedy startup- Very little shutter lag- Good quality photos (amazing, considering it's a small folded lens)- InexpensiveWeak points:- The anchor for the wrist strap is unusually large and slightly obtrusive.- Video quality is good- No cover for the lens, but you can probably work around it.What this camera is good for:- "go anywhere" camera, I wear it on a lanyard around my neck and don't even notice it's there- nice for family and travel snapshots and occasional video- even experienced photographers will appreciate the photo quality and responsiveness of this camera wrapped in such a small package.I would highly recommend this camera for someone who wants a small, "take anywhere" camera that takes very good photos and good videos.  Even an experienced photographer can appreciate what Panasonic has achieved with this camera at it's price point.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: John A. Carroll "JCINPA"
Reviews.Content: Takes very good pictures - fast focus and response as well - highly recommended for a point and shoot camera, if you want manual controls look elsewhere...

Reviews.Title: Super camera
Reviews.Author: A.W.
Reviews.Content: This camera goes way beyond what I had come to expect for cameras of this nature.I had bought a Sony tx7 & it was complete garbage...pics were a hot mess & the supposedly 1080i video was horrible lol.the FP8 video is incredibly clear which is what I mainly got it for.the pictures are beautiful & it's just hard to believe all of that comes from a tiny camera that fits in your pocket!!! Also picked up the Panasonic ZS7....incredible sums that camera up.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Mangum "AstroDude"
Reviews.Content: Bought to replace an old 4M Canon.  Works great.  Takes fantastic movies in addition to very high quality stills.  Fast picture write makes a short delay between pics also.

Reviews.Title: Features and Picture quality make this camera a good choice despite appearance.
Reviews.Author: Let's Go Bruins
Reviews.Content: So I'll start by saying the only 2 cons I have with this camera. First it looks a little odd. Since it does not have a telescope lens like other cameras it looks a little different and not " cute"  Also  some of the buttons are made of plastic. Great quality but I'm used to a different feel.  That said I think the picture quality and ease of use with great features make this a STEAL!!! at this price. This camera takes better pics than my 14.1 mega pixel cannon power shot and has the clarity of a Rebel with much easier use. This is an amazing camera and I'm buying 2 as gifts today!!

Reviews.Title: Totally worth the buy!
Reviews.Author: L. J. Karnes
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a birthday gift for my wife.  She wanted something she could keep in her purse all the time; instead of being bummed she didn't lug around her very high grade Digital SLR by Canon.  It is perfect!  Exactly what she wanted, small, easy to use, and great pics (no, not the same quality as the SLR, but close for everyday pics).  Additionally, it has a good battery life and was selected after I read up on this type of camera on [...].  It is not the most attractive point and shoot camera, and you can only use the 2.7" viewfinder, as opposed to an eyepiece finder, BUT don't let that dissuade you!  This camera can come at a decent price if you shop around and is completely worth the buy.  We have had it for almost a month now and it has been great.One other bit of advice, my wife learned the hard way, read the manual.  It performs a lot of functions and if you are just messing around with settings, you will make a mistake and need to default back to factory settings.

Reviews.Title: Wanted to love it; it's been 6 months - I don't
Reviews.Author: Golfing Fool
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews, I had a SONY digital that still worked fine but thought it had been 3 years; time for an upgrade - reasonable $ - great reviews so I ordered end of May 2010.I love it in daylight and good indoor lighting.  It is compact, fits in my pocket.  I am amateur enthusiast; enjoy family, friends, pets, nature but don't pretend to be anything but an amateur.I concur with a previous reviewer, anything where the flash goes off is washed out, esp. if there is any kind of indoor lighting glare.  (While I am an amateur, I don't aim at the light... it doesn't matter).It is the first camera I have really been disappointed in.  I have a Panasonic higher-end (but bulkier) digital and my previous Sony W80.  I continue to search for the perfect camera but was happier with previous purchases.

Reviews.Title: Poor picture quality
Reviews.Author: Mike Applebee
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for the upcoming holiday season.  After reading many reviews and also seeing that it was a Consumer Reports winner, I decided to get the FP8.  The menu on it was not as easy to navigate as a Canon or Kodak, but it was manageable.  My biggest complaint is that it does not take good pictures.  In low light, it is very grainy.  If the flash goes off, it washes out everything.  Even in the daytime, the pictures are not that sharp.  I have an older 7 megapixel Kodak that takes much better pictures that this camera does.  I would have to say that I am very unsatisfied with my first Panasonic camera.  I was under the impression that they made some of the best cameras, but I don't know anymore.  I could understand if it didn't cost that much, but I paid more for the FP8 than I have ever paid for a digital camera, and it was the worst one I have ever used as far as picture quality.  I am definitely going to return this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great little pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Stephen Gerow "HealeySteve"
Reviews.Content: I've been using this camera for several years and am extremely happy with it. I love the periscope-style lens behind the glass. It keeps dust out of the interior of the camera. My previous camera, a Nikon pocket camera, got dust on the CCD after a while. A repair person informed me the in-and-out action of the lens eventually sucks dust into the interior of the camera, resulting in in-focus specks in the images.The Lumix FP8 has been free of that and gives very sharp pictures and fast reset-action to boot. I'm old-school and the picture quality appears to me like a good 2-1/4 image from the old film days.I'm disappointed that this style of camera appears to have been discontinued except for the bulkier "Tough" series.

Reviews.Title: A Gift That Keeps on Giving
Reviews.Author: Dan T. L.
Reviews.Content: I gave this camera to a high school graduate and he's used it for the past two years with very good results.  I suspect it has had a bit of abuse, you recall Freshman Year in College, but it continues to operate as expected.  I just opened a few photos from it today I discovered in my e mail in box.  I recommend it to you.

Reviews.Title: powerful camera to be so small
Reviews.Author: Trying to be healthy in Texas
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a gift for my wife.  She is a hard core scrap booker and is very particular about the quality of the pictures she uses.  I have a large camera that takes excellent photos, but due to the size is not handy.  She wanted a camera that she could have with her all the time to be able to capture all those special shots, and the size of this camera fit the bill.  I did research quite a bit prior to purchasing this camera for her, but she was surprised and impressed with the quality of the camera.At 12.1-megapixel resolution, the photo quality is very good, and the lens clarity is surprising for the size.  It has a 4.6x optical zoom, so don't be expecting to shoot close ups of the bird in the tree.  But my wife shoots almost all people, and is usually close enough that the zoom is not used, or she only needs a little boost.Overall, this is a very good quality, very small camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Hayley P. Bubb "coventry"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. Small, stylish, easy to use and the most important part - it takes great photos. I would definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Gets the job done
Reviews.Author: brad layne
Reviews.Content: I have this camera for over 2 years now, i bought this camera off the recommendations from Consumer Reports.  I bought this right before I moved to Guam for 2 years.  I took hundreds and hundreds of pictures of the island and the pictures are so clear and great looking.  My only complaint is that the battery life isn't very good, after 3 to 4 hours it would be down to 1 bar, that's from taking few pictures then riding and stopping to take more pictures.  Anyways, I would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great digital camera
Reviews.Author: asarkozy
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace an older camera and this is light, compact, takes great pictures, has great ratings and is so easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Error messages
Reviews.Author: Stu
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in Jun 2010.  I was completely satisfied with it until a few weeks ago when I started getting an error message, 'Please turn camera off and then on again', a minute or so after turning it on.  Panasonic support suggested that I reset the camera but that did not help - unless you count getting a new error message, 'SYSTEM ERROR (O.I.S.)'.  So I turned off the Optical Image Stabilizer, (O.I.S.) but still get the error.  Panasonic did offer to repair my camera for $128.  For a camera that cost $170 18 month ago, that seems expensive.  So I'm in the market for a new camera made by anyone except Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Great  price and battery life!!
Reviews.Author: Jesse A. Baker "ravenous"
Reviews.Content: I use this camera everyday and take over 500 photos on 1 charge! Fast startup and flash recharge time. Wide angle is a great addition. Extra care is needed of the lens, which becomes smudged with finger prints. If you looking for a basic, reliable, everyday use camera, with excellent battery life, you can't beat this deal. For under $150 shipped, you cant go wrong!

Reviews.Title: Happy I bought it
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I really liked my husband's Panasonic camera.  His is larger and uses AA batteries.  That's one thing I would prefer, but this camera is quite small and so has to use a battery pack.  This little camera has tons of features for such an inexpensive camera.  So far I have been very impressed.  I don't know how to use everything yet, but the intelligent auto feature really takes care of that.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: jus' Dan "dp"
Reviews.Content: Fits in your pocket, takes excellent pictures, easy to use. I'm pretty much a point and shoot guy, so I can't speak much to the features, but it certainly does everything I need it to do. I've had it almost a year and it has held up well so far.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Fiddler
Reviews.Content: I really like the camera. The reviews and pictures posted from the camera with different settings was very helpful in my decision. The price was right..the controls are very SMALL and hard to see esp if you're over 50..  Overall, it's a very nice camera, easy to use, and I would recommend it to nearly everyone.

Reviews.Title: good camera, takes beautiful pics, long battery life
Reviews.Author: Bridget
Reviews.Content: i really enjoyed this camera for the 6 months i had it - i sadly lost it on new year's eve :( - it took really beautiful pictures (i took it on a few vacations and the photos came out gorgeous and i barely even knew how to use the settings) and the battery life is amazing the best i've ever had in a camera. the only thing i didn't love about it was the zoom, it's 4x, and it wasn't the greatest but overall it was a good little camera. i plan on buying another Panasonic Lumix to replace this one!!

Reviews.Title: Great Pocket Camera
Reviews.Author: Jerry T - Buffalo
Reviews.Content: This item was purchased as a Christmas present for my wife, who researched the crap out of finding the right camera.  To her, the following attributes were essential:1.  Quick reload - It's important to be able to take another picture quickly. We are Very Satisfied.2.  Stabilization - My wife has trouble being still when she takes a picture.  This camera easily satisfies this need.  We have already taken 100s of great quality pictures of moving children, lighted trees and family in dark light.  In all instances, we have taken great pictures.Personally, I am a big fan of the camera's styling.  It is a sleek black with a nice screen.We have received complaints about the camera's flash being too bright :(  Additionally, it will take some time to get used to the lens being located in the upper left hand corner of the camera (when looking at the camera's back).  It's exactly where an index finger may be carelessly placed.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Kirk A. Klinger
Reviews.Content: The reason I picked this particular camera was speed.  It is fast (shutter lag and time between photos).  Having a rechargeable lithium battery is also great instead of using AA batteries.

Reviews.Title: Want simple and this is not great , just ok
Reviews.Author: CL "Coffee Lover"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera that had the lens internal.  My last 2 cameras got sand and the lens stopped retracting on one of them.This camera requires the user to make adjustments between night and day shots.  If not, the pix in daylight get whited out.  And once you make that setting, you have to change for night shots or they will be too dark.  Even making those adjustments, the pictures are still not as clear and nice as my previous Cannon Powershot 1100 cameras (at less megapixels).Also, there is no built in protection to prevent lens scratch when not using a camera pouch/bag.  I like to just put my cameras directly in my pants pocket or purse.I am going back to the Cannon (now a 1300 for about same price as this camera)Also note that the cheapest price I got for this was discount jungle through Amazon, but I did not research well enough - there is a 15% restock fee plus shipping costs.  I'm going to resell on E*bay to re-coop my costs.

Reviews.Title: What I expected...
Reviews.Author: JC
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with most of the reviews before I purchased this camera.  I must say, it has fulfilled all my expectations.  Portability, picture quality, ease of use and sturdy construction were the primary things I expected.  I own a Panasonic Lumix DMC TZ3 that is bulky at dinner parties, banquets, etc.  This camera can easily slip into my pocket without seeming out of place.  But because it does not have a lens cover, I carry it in a case.  What surprised me most about this camera is the long battery life.  I don't have to take a spare battery or the recharger.  I highly recommend this camera to anyone looking for an ultra compact camera.

Reviews.Title: Style and function had a child. They named it Panasonic Lumix DMC-FP8.
Reviews.Author: BlackHistory "AmBlake"
Reviews.Content: I didn't read the manual yet, and I don't necessarily need to. Its really easy to figure out and operate this camera. I haven't used many features yet, instead I usually keep it on ia (intelligent auto). Perfect for candid shots other cameras would have trouble capturing. This camera takes quick, crisp shots, and zooms without extendending its lenses. Some shots can be a little blurry despite the image stabilization, but that's not a frequent problem. I love it so far.

Reviews.Title: Luminx
Reviews.Author: Frank
Reviews.Content: I have only had this camera for 6 weeks, but so far I am happy with the performance.  The only issue I have had so far is that you have to make sure you keep your finger out of the exposure area.  With the lens so close to the edge it is easy to have a portion of your finger in the picture.  The quality has been good, the control features are good and I am much happier with this one vice my old Olympus that suddenly disappeared.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased to replace my old camera it is totally awesome and I only wish I had bought it sooner, Easy to use set up just point shoot

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FP8 12.1 MP Camera GREAT!
Reviews.Author: John Potts
Reviews.Content: Purchased this to replace my heavy powerful full sized zoom camera and wow... what a great camera!  It is just amazingly clear & easy to use with the auto mode or as complicted as you want with the full range of manual options... and the zoom can be increased dramatically by choosing a smaller pic size.  Resizing & zooming can all be done after you take the pic on the camera.  Have taken and downloaded 400 plus pics so far & used the flash about 5 times as it is not needed in auto mode & has amazing light reception qualities.  And, the lens, including the zoom does not protrude outside the camera!  Does all a large heavy one does but is so small, goes in my shirt pocket!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic FP8 review
Reviews.Author: TTWeston
Reviews.Content: Consitently get blurry pictures indoor under natural light when shooting objects at a distance ( object has slight movement ). Pushing ISO to 1600 and power O.I.S only helps a little but the shots get very grainy. Sometimes pictures taken outdoor is washed out with overhead sun. May be a better camera if design change from F3.3 to F2.5 to handle the difficult lighting situation. Also too many steps to switch from video to still mode. Take excellent video and Macro shots. Stills are also great except for issues above.

Reviews.Title: A wonderful experience
Reviews.Author: John Gutierrez
Reviews.Content: The best compact camera I've ever had, excellent photography and great clarity in the video.

Reviews.Title: Easy, fun camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "gdiddy"
Reviews.Content: I've enjoyed this camera more than I thought I would. The ease of operation for a camera novice was appreciated. If I had this purchase to do over, I would.

Reviews.Title: Great Point anc Click Camera,,,
Reviews.Author: Mr. Riffs "DW"
Reviews.Content: Just got the camera cause I wanted one that could get good shots in the dark.  I took it to a concert and the pictures are amazing..and all I had to do is put it on AUTO.  Easy to use, great pi...cs, great video

Reviews.Title: Photos are overexposed
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Almost every still photo taken with this camera is overexposed and washed-out looking. Sometimes it is the whole photo, and sometimes it is just a corner or a side. This is on the camera's Intelligent Auto setting, which should be fully automatic. This is very puzzling to me, as no other digital camera I've owned has done this or anything similar. Maybe it is a defective unit. I am sending it back.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FP8
Reviews.Author: MommieMe "Lea"
Reviews.Content: Easy ordering, the best price around and fast delivery.  Can't get any better than that.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Martha B. Galletta "mbg"
Reviews.Content: We really are impressed with this camera and would reccommend it to anyone looking for a digital camera. It has great features that are easy to use.

Reviews.Title: In door quality is horrible
Reviews.Author: Michael W. Smith
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera through Amazon based on the reviews I have read and I am not happy with the quality of the in door pictures, everything seems to come up with a red hue, maybe I am doing something wrong but with all my prior point and shoots from Canon I never had this issue when using the fully auto mode.  Not happy and to late to return it.  If I am doing something wrong and anyone can help please let me know.  Thanks.

Reviews.Title: No ZOOM!
Reviews.Author: Christina
Reviews.Content: Pros:Fast on, compact, nice view screen, easy to upload to computerCons:Hardly any zoom, have to change modes and jump through hoops just to delete the picture you just took.  You can't choose to delete it while it's showing you the preview.  I've found it powered on while in my purse, so the power switch is a little too easy to knock on.  When the camera is on it shows the date but when you get the pictures printed the date isn't on there.  I haven't yet found how to fix that.It has some nice features but it's not user friendly, so you can't just play with it and figure out how to access the features; really have to learn it and work with it.

Reviews.Title: Muy linda y práctica cam!
Reviews.Author: Agustin Suarez "Guga10"
Reviews.Content: El precio es muy bueno. La calidad es muy buena para una pocket. Creo que me queda mucho por investigar. Lo único "malo" es el cable, diferente al típico de todas las demás. Excelente experiencia comprar Panasonic Lumix. Saludos!

ProductInfo.Features:
12.1-megapixel resolution
28mm wide-angle lens with 4.6x optical zoom; POWER O.I.S.
Capture HD video at 1280x720, 30fps
2.7-inch  TFT LCD screen
Capture images to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FP8 12.1MP Digital Camera with 4.6x POWER Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7 inch LCD (Black)
